intro: Amblyanthera funiformis var. brevipedunculata, commonly known as the short-stalked amblyanthera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine pubescence. This variant is distinguished by its shorter peduncles compared to the typical form of Amblyanthera funiformis.
